decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of  the carrying out of the works permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the local planning authority.  REASON: To safeguard the architectural and/or historic interest of the building. | Works for making good the internal or external fabric shall not be conmenced until details of the method and materials, as appropriate, in respect of the following shall be submitted to  and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing prior to the commencement of work: (a) workmanship (b) mortar mix (c) brick materials (facing bricks) (d) plaster (internal)  REASON:      In order to safeguard the special historic interest of the building | If hitherto unknown evidence of historic character that would be affected by the works hereby permitted is discovered or likely to be revealed, an appropriate record together with recommendations for dealing with it in the context of the scheme, shall be submitted in writing to the Local Planning Authority before any alterations take place.  REASON:  To safeguard the character of the listed building. | The replacement cast iron down pipes shall be painted.  Details of the paint colour shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing prior to the commencement of work.  The painting of the down pipes shall only be executed in accordance with the details as approved.  Reason:   In order to safeguard the special historic interest of the building
description: Replacement of existing cast iron down pipes, internal works to provide two new ensuite bathrooms and associated drainage and pipework
